name: Basic Web Application
description: Comprehensive template for basic web application projects following context engineering principles
author: Context Engineering MCP Server

sections.title: Project Overview
sections.content: Define the core purpose and scope of {{projectName}} in the {{domain}} domain. This section should clearly articulate what the application will do and why it's needed.
examples: {{projectName}} is a task management application that helps teams coordinate work
The application serves users in the {{domain}} industry with specific workflow needs

sections.title: Stakeholders
sections.content: List all stakeholders involved in {{projectName}} and their roles in the project. Include primary users, secondary users, and decision makers.
examples: End users who will interact with the application daily
System administrators who will maintain the application

sections.title: Functional Requirements
sections.content: Detail what the {{projectName}} application must do. Include core features, user workflows, and system behaviors.

sections.title: Non-Functional Requirements
sections.content: Specify performance, security, and usability requirements for {{projectName}}. Address scalability, reliability, and maintainability concerns.
examples: Response time must be under 2 seconds

sections.title: Technical Constraints
sections.content: Document any technical limitations or requirements that will impact the development of {{projectName}}. Include technology stack, infrastructure, and integration constraints.

sections.title: Success Criteria
sections.content: Define how success will be measured for {{projectName}}. Include both technical and business metrics.
examples: User adoption rate of 80% within 6 months
